PidDroneControl module

Vision Based Navigation Project Augusta University 3/11/2022

This file contains the PidDroneControl class. This class uses two PID controllers to determine a control value to send to the drone to help it reach a specific position. One PID controls the x movement (left/right) of the drone. The second PID controls the y (forward/back) movement of the drone.

PidDroneControl.py

class PidDroneControl.PidDroneControl(drone_object: djitellopy.tello.Tello, point: point.Point, instance_num, kp, ki, kd)[source]

Bases: object

Class that uses simple_pid to generate control values to send to a Tello drone.

__init__(drone_object: djitellopy.tello.Tello, point: point.Point, instance_num, kp, ki, kd)[source]

Sets everything up. Instance_num is vital to ensure proper control. This instance number links the drone object/ip with its proper ID. If the wrong instance number is assigned, the controller will be getting the position (measured value) from a different drone than it is controlling.

Parameters

  • drone_object (Tello) – The drone object that this controller with control

  • point (point.Point) – The setpoint of the controlelr

  • instance_num (int) – The instance number of the drone object that corresponds to the id in the ID.instances list.

update_velocity()[source]

Method to get get the position of the drone, use it to compute the new control value, and update the velocity of the drone accordingly

update_setpoints(setpoint)[source]

Method used to change the setpoint of the controller.

Parameters

setpoint (point.Point) – The desired position to move the drone to

takeoff()[source]

Method to make the drone fly
